main event: A bright white object, the size of a pin's head, was observed on radar moving west and north, making a sudden 90-degree turn before disappearing quickly.
interesting points: The object was initially sighted while the observer was looking for the planet Venus.
The object made an abrupt right-angle turn towards the west, followed by another abrupt turn towards the north before disappearing quickly.
The sighting lasted for approximately one minute.
No probable cause for the sighting was identified after preliminary analysis.
The report included a hand-drawn sketch of an oval-shaped object.
sighted object: A bright white, pin-head sized object
location: 4.4 miles NNW of San Antonio, Texas
witnesses: Civilian rock quarry drill rig operator, considered reliable
photographs: No photographs, only a filled-out Project 10073 record card
